page.title: 10Historic Buildings of Clun
page.content: The remains of Clun Castle consist of the keep, part of two round towers and a small portion of wall. The keep is unusual in that it is built on the side of the motte. Clun Castle has two baileys. One is now a bowling green. The Town Hall stands in the square. Above the door is the coat of arms of Lord Clive. The top storey of the town hall is now the parish council chamber and the bottom storey is Clun Museum. The vicarage was built in about 1700. There is one wood panelled room and an attractive staircase. The garden contains large herbaceous borders. In the Parish Church, the pyx canopy above the altar, and north aisle roof (with angels on either side), are medieval.There is a Jacobean pulpit and panelling in the Lady Chapel . A brass memorial to Sir Robert Howard is also in the Lady Chapel.
